Articles.Content:
I'm finally wrapping up my old .24 save (getting out to Jool took a long time), and I'm not very happy with the part I cobbled together for a surface-attached atmosphere sensor over a year ago. The new stock part (as of 1.0) would be perfect, but converting it to the old format is beyond my rudimentary skills; I copied the model over and converted the textures to .png (and then renamed back to .dds so .24 will read them), but they're all mixed up. Can someone just... do it for me?

Edited August 30, 2015 by sumghai
Un-redacted original post (see my reasoning below)
"Mixed up"? I'm guessing what you're seeing is the fact that DDS textures expect the image to be flipped vertically as compared to what is stored in the PNG.

aaaand that did it. shows how little I know.

The rest, I should be able to handle myself. Thanks, NecroBones.

aaaand that did it. shows how little I know.

The rest, I should be able to handle myself. Thanks, NecroBones.

No problem, glad it helped!

[MOD - I've un-redacted the original post.

Folks, just a reminder that even if you've asked an embarrassing or "stupid" question, please don't blank out your original question once it has been answered. Other people may have the same problem, and keeping your original questions / intermediary responses helps them understand the context of the problem / the flow of logic to reach the solution better.]
